title: BRIEF-Moody's Says APAC Banks Face Growing Risk From Leveraged Corporates As Macroeconomic Conditions Weaken
text:
BRIEF-Moody's Says APAC Banks Face Growing Risk From Leveraged Corporates As Macroeconomic Conditions Weaken

Stock Markets 18 minutes ago (Sep 30, 2019 07:40)

© Reuters. BRIEF-Moody's Says APAC Banks Face Growing Risk From Leveraged Corporates As Macroeconomic Conditions Weaken Sept 29 (Reuters) - Moody's: * MOODY'S SAYS APAC BANKS FACE GROWING RISK FROM LEVERAGED CORPORATES AS MACROECONOMIC CONDITIONS WEAKEN * MOODY'S ON APAC BANKS SAYS INTENSIFYING TRADE & GEOPOLITICAL TENSIONS WEIGHNING ON GLOBAL ECONOMY AND SUPPLY CHAINS AMID ALREADY SLOWING GROWTH * MOODY'S ON APAC BANKS SAYS STRESS TEST SHOWS BANKS IN INDIA AND INDONESIA MOST PRONE TO A DETERIORATION IN CORPORATE DEBT REPAYMENT CAPACITY

BRIEF-Moody's Says APAC Banks Face Growing Risk From Leveraged Corporates As Macroeconomic Conditions Weaken
description: BRIEF-Moody's Says APAC Banks Face Growing Risk From Leveraged Corporates As Macroeconomic Conditions Weaken
